titleStmt.title: The Trappan trapt. Or The true relation of a cunning, cogging, confident, crafty, counterfeit, cosening and cheating knight, alias knave. Wherein is discovered his mischievous and Machivillian matchlesse mischeefs, plotted against an honest gentleman, a marchant of good repute, named Mr Iohn Marriot: dwelling neer London Bridge. Set forth for the benfit of others, who else through ignorance might easily fall into the like snares of such dissembling, vvicked, and trecherous Trappans. By W.B.
titleStmt.author: W. B.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Joseph Moxon, and sold at his shop on Corn-hill, at the sign of Atlas,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
